No closet just a Chiffarobe. Most storage space was taken up by the refrigerators of over priced goodies. Had to lay my phone on the floor by the outlet to charge! The casino folks were friendly. The casino itsef was a little and a bit widy curvey and tight old but I enjoyed it. The walk to access tbe strip was simple except for when you were going thru all the vendors. The Valet parking was a little slow and getting into the valet parking from the strip is a Full On Nightmare... Like I said the place is okay but I won't go back and stay there. I will find another Harrah's property. I actually like IP much better as far as the room is concerned.

reviews.author: Akeem Stroman
reviews.content: We are in our mid 50's and have stayed at Harrahs twice before. We always enjoy the friendly staff and casino also the short distance from your rooom to the strip. I had a comped room this time and did not ask for an upgrade or view. We were on the 6th floor of the Mardi Gras Tower. Very quiet and a short distance from the elevator. Beds had good linen and were very comfortable. I spent one day at the pool. Quiet and relaxing, no loud music that day anyway. An older crowd. A few young people but no kids. I ordered lunch there..food was good and reasonably priced. Drink service was good also. There were cabanas but none were in use that day. Drink service was good in the casino anytime of the day or night. Overall a good midpriced hotel right in the centre of the strip.

reviews.author: Ezra Stoltenberg
reviews.content: We had the best time ever , great deal and room was very nice good size and away from noise .Great selection of economical food and stores One minor complaint staff at other harrah's have been much more attentive but for price don't mind if they don't look up when they talk to you . Will definitely be back !!!

reviews.author: Madge West IV
reviews.content: They say the first person you meet sets the tone for the remainder of your stay and I never knew how true that is. I recently checked in at Harrah's while on a get-away trip with friends. When I got to the desk the girl was the most rude person I've experienced in a long while. McDonald's drive-thru staff have better customer service skills. I looked at the other checking in guests and they all seemed to be equally as miserable but the one I had won the prize. Since she couldn't handle the check in, 'Alame' didn't get anything right with the rooms. During the process with her perceived problems she went to a supervisor for assistance who seemed to just as unhappy with his job as she was. So, the check-in was terrible, the rooms were not right, and the rudeness of this person set the tone for the rest of my stay.

title: Rouen

address: Route du Bosc Theroulde - 76710 Bosc Theroulde
description: B&B 8 miles from the city center,within easy access from the A-28-A29-A151 motorways, this is an elegant Napoleon III style building in a fully secured walled park of 4 ha.
name: Château du Bosc Theroulde
title: Rouen

description: Friendly hotel with wifi in the common areas. Some English is spoken.
directions: Along the main road from Bastia towards the city center
name: Hotel Bellevue
title: Saint-Florent

description: Nice hotel with friently service. Free use of bicycles for guests. Free WiFi
name: Santa Maria

reviews.author: Javonte Grady
reviews.content: The title says it all. We arrived late (around 10pm) but even then had to wait half an hour to check in. When we finally got to a receptionist she advised that we had been upgraded. Having reserved a room with a king bed or 2 queens we werent quite sure what to expect. However, when we got to our room we discovered we had been allocated a dreadful room. It had a really odd layout; the lounge area was bigger than the sleeping area and the two were separated with a wall which blocked out most of the light from the one small window. To add insult to injury the bed was a standard double and they had left a pull out bed in the lounge area. We asked for the pull out to be moved immediately as it took up so much space and it was still there an hour later - when we called down to again we were told it would be in the next hour - this was at 11.35pm so we told them the next five minutes or not to bother - we were just on the point of moving it into the corridor ourselves some 20 minutes later when someone finally came to take it away. To top it all off we were right next to the lift shaft and, being Vegas, we could hear the lifts all night. We had gone straight downstairs to complain when we were first shown the room but received a none to helpful or friendly response - the long & short of it being they were full so we could put up and shut up and try again the next morning to see if we could be moved. When we asked what was "upgrade" about that particular room we were told it was the view. Our view from our less than big window was the car park. The following morning we went downstairs at 10pm to see if there was another room available (on the way we could see just how awful our room was compared to others which were much more spacious, had king or 2 queen beds and big picture windows) and were told this would be possible but that they could not give us the room number until 12 noon. We were only in Vegas for 4 days and frankly did not want to spend half a day waiting around in the hotel but seemingly had little choice so we went to the pool area. The staff there were just as indifferent to their guests and made no show of hiding their boredom. There was nothing attractive about the pool area - all flat hard concrete with nothing to soften the edges (no planting nothing, just sunbeds and the pool and very little shade with only a few umbrellas). On top of this they had R & B blaring from the speakers situated all around the pool - this was so loud that it drowned out my ipod. It was the straw that broke the camel's back and after 15 minutes i went down to research alternative accommodation on the internet. When we went to check out 1/2 an hour later the reception made it clear that they really couldnt have cared less. I've since written to the hotel to complain and not even received a response. The only plus point? The door staff - they were totally charming and polite - a complete contrast to the reception staff who really couldnt give a damn - they could certainly learn a few lessons from them. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

reviews.author: Buck Casper
reviews.content: I stayed with my friend at the Stratosphere hotel. This wasn't my first stay, I went there with my family several times. Every stay was simply GREAT! I really love the value you get in this hotel. Okay, it isn't in the "heart of the Strip" but you can get there very fast. We had a very spacious, clean room and paid only $40 per night! This is an amazing deal! Furthermore, we ate at the "Top of the world restaurant" which was an amazing experience!! We loved, loved the view over the whole city and the food was great! The service was brilliant and the staff very friendly!! If you stay at the Stratosphere don't miss the restaurant and the bar on top of the tower! Try to make reservations, it can get really crowded, especially on the weekends. We really liked the pool, it offers sunbeds and also towels for the guests. Even if not located in the middle of the strip, Stratosphere is a really nice location to spend your Vegas expirience. Why not saving a little money on accomodation and spend the saved money on gambling or nightlife? Stay at the Stratosphere, it's a great place!

reviews.author: Queenie Koepp
reviews.content: Our 3rd visit to the Stratosphere just a couple of days this time. In a year there are some signs of a downward trend. The buffet while good value at $24.99 a day has gone down in quality and variety. It was amongst the best previously in my opinion. Our room upgrade never materialised and the one we received was very drab and dark and ill equipped compared to previous visits. The comps and cash backs have significantly reduced. The slots were much tighter. The staff were very helpful friendly and polite. Its position is now compromised having become a sleazy area at night and appreciably away from the main strip attractions. Very good value for money however and its acceptable for a short stay. Free gaming lessons in the morning and cheap tournament places always available. Use the Deuce Bus to travel the strip $7 / 24hr unlimited usage - goes right out to the Premium Mall at the opposite end of town,

reviews.author: Rebecca Luettgen
reviews.content: Loved it - not too tizzy, or "themed" beyond the boundaries of taste to witihn an inch of its life. Yes, it's right up one end of the Strip, but we liked this. Being away a little from all the hustle suited us just fine. If you are inclined you can walk the length of the Strip from the Stratosphere, or you can use the Deuce - a cheap bus that meanders slowly along. Our room was great - 22nd floor, great view, clean, very comfortable beds. All the staff were very frinedly, helpful and courteous. We ate in several different areas of the hotel as well as having room service on our first night and enjoyed them all. The buffet was great value with plenty of choice of food. The bar prices were very cheap compared to toher hotels on the Strip.

reviews.author: Reece Hermann
reviews.content: We were out visiting family in the Las Vegas area and we always stay at the Stratosphere. We tend not to wander the Strip, been there done that, and wanted a hotel that we could relax in and really enjoy Las Vegas and it's beautiful desert. I love that there is ample parking and the hotel staff is always helpful. We had a problem with the TV remote not working, we thought it was maybe the batteries not working, but they came up w/a spare remote and a tech to see if there was something more with the TV. Once they realized it was actually the TV the tech quickly fixed it and was extremely courteous. We've never had a problem at the Stratosphere and will always stay here whenever we visit Las Vegas. The views at the top of the observation deck on the tower are fabulous! The city itself has many wonderful museums and parks, explore them you'll see that Las Vegas is an amazing destination.

title: Saint-Florent

description: Beautiful two star hotel down a quiet road right off the tourist area within the old medieval city. It is close to the tourist office, main bus stop, and many restaurants. Comfortable and clean rooms renovated in an 19th century mansion with a lovely private patio area in the rear, breakfast is offered for €9.
name: Hotel Des Cymaises

reviews.author: Aron Bogan
reviews.content: We stayed for a week. The location is great to get to the airport and many different sites that San Diego offers. The staff including the owners were friendly and helpful. Everyday we got clean towels and the maid without asking us changed our sheets twice! The room is small and it sits on the corner of a quiet street and a main street- at times it was noisy at night. The walls are thin and two nights we had people next to us that listened to TV till the wee hours of the morning. Finally, I convinced my husband to wear earplugs like I do. The bed, pillows and blankets were comfortable. Overall, great location and reasonable rates!

reviews.author: Makenzie Zulauf I
reviews.content: This is an incredibly friendly and welcoming family run motel in a great location. The staff were very attentive and went out of their way to be helpful. We would have no qualms about staying here again.

reviews.author: Alexandre Streich
reviews.content: I discovered Dolphin Motel last year while taking a walk on Scott street during my annual trip to San Diego. This year I decided to try it and I realized that I should have tried it before. My first impression while checking in is the nice welcome from Tom at the front desk. All the staff here are very polite and always do their best to accommodate the guests. Mr Murdock, the owner, asked me if all was correct with my room and kindly gave me advices and tips to make my trip to San Diego more pleasant. The rooms are small but very clean and well kept with a big flat-screen TV, a fridge and air-conditioned. The beds and pillows are comfortable. This motel is also well located, close to the airport and easily accessible by public transport buses. The free breakfast served from 6 to 10 AM includes fresh coffee, tea, muffins, bananas, yogurt and orange juice. Stayed from Sept. 26 to Oct. 1, 2011 and I will certainly return next year.

title: Semur-en-Auxois

description: Grand Hotel offers twin, double, triple and quad rooms with no, half and full-board. 2-minute walk from the ski lift station and a ski rental shop (discounts available).
name: Grand Hotel Serre Chevalier

reviews.author: Cody Blanda Jr.
reviews.content: When we tried to book a hotel room for our one night stay in San Diego, I contacted a travel agent to find us a good deal. The bargain she found for us was $160 per night in a decent hotel near Seaworld. As all we were looking for was a clean, safe place to crash for the night, I decided to do a little search of my own and I am glad I did. I stumbled upon this hidden gem on tripadvisor. This quiet little motel cost us less than half of my travel agent's bargain. The rooms were clean and the customer service impeccable. I highly recommend this place and I myself will stay there without second thought.

reviews.author: Cortez Aufderhar
reviews.content: When I travel I try to stay at clean, family run hotels and this place fits the bill. It's nice to talk to the owners Alan & Holly over their continental breakfast every morning. Rooms were very clean as usual and the staff helpful and friendly. Love this place! Makes me feel at home...I'll be back. P.S. Don't much care for the big impersonal chains.

reviews.author: Brennan Bednar
reviews.content: I echo the previous reviews. Yes, the rooms are small and it has minimal amenities, but it is VERY clean, is available for a good price and has an excellentand central location. Perfect for staging a long range fishing trip or playing touriston a budget. Everyone there was extremely helpful. I had family issues which required that I extend my stay. They really made things easier. You could easily come to think of them as extended family.

reviews.author: Dejah Abernathy
reviews.content: The Dolphin has very clean, well appointed rooms, and a nice sized bathroom. Great location near to the marina with a choice of restaurants, and the bus into the centre stops about 10 yards away. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, which always makes a great difference to any stay. Good continental breakfast. Free use of a laptop with WiFi connection was also an added unexpected bonus. Doubt you'll find better value for money in the area. One word of warning - if you're not coming by car, its better to get public transport to the motel, which is regular and good if you're arriving from the centre - we got thoroughly ripped off by a taxi.

reviews.author: Mavis Rogahn
reviews.content: We have visited SD twice before, staying at the Homewood Suites in Del Mar and Motel 6 respectively. This time we wanted to try a location in Point Loma for a number of good reasons. After considering several options (most of the Pt. Loma properties are clustered close together) we opted to try the Dolphin based mainly on price and TripAdvisor reviews. We drove in after dark on I-8 and turned onto Nimitz Ave. at the end of the freeway which brought us right to the Dolphin. Our reservation was accepted and we checked in without problem. Our room was on the second floor which was fine. On first impression we were a bit surprised at the compactness of the room which reminded me of some I had stayed in throughout the UK. Apart from that the room was clean to an acceptable standard and everything that was in it worked accordingly. The place has a kind of '70's feel to it which we have experienced at other SoCal accomodations! We found that the Dolphin was a combination of several pluses and a couple of minuses. The pluses included being situated in Pt. Loma which is a self contained community with most amenities within easy walking distance of the Dolphin. There is a great selection of restaurants, C stores, laundromat, gas stations etc. nearby and the streets are safe to walk after dark. In many ways it resembles most large towns that you would find on the Great Plains with that same "Howdy neighbour" friendliness. Pt. Loma is also strategically located in SD to provide quick access to all of the local attractions. We found that having wi-fi was a great convenience as we packed the laptop along. Morning coffee,OJ, and muffins are served in the outdoor courtyard which is very nice on warm sunny mornings. As many other commenters have mentioned the staff and management are very nice folks. The minuses were few and rather petty. The hotel doesn't have a pool (one is located beside the office but belongs to the neighbouring Comfort Inn.) The hotel advertises itself as being on a quiet street (Garrison) which is technically correct, however it is sandwiched between two very busy streets (Rosecrans and Scott). My wife likes to sleep with the windows open and the early morning traffic was very noticeable. The street traffic can be overcome by closing the windows and turning on the circulating fan. Another irritant was the vibrating roar of fighter jets taking off from North Island late in the evening. The snug rooms are fine for sleeping but don't expect to entertain guests. Overall we were quite satisfied with our stay at the Dolphin and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to San Diego.

reviews.author: Danika Lesch
reviews.content: My wife and I stayed at The Dolphin for three nights in July 2008. The room was clean, neat, safe, and very comfortable. As some of the other reviewers mentioned, the rooms are a little small, but we were on the go constantly, so it worked out fine for us. The owners and staff are always around seeing to your every need. All of our basic needs were met including a very comfortable bed. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when visiting San Diego.

reviews.author: Cecil Purdy
reviews.content: DH and I stayed here one night pre-cruise and thought it was worth every penny. The owners are sweet, sweet people and actually apologized for chatting with us so long. We assured him we southern folks are used to chatting with strangers on a daily basis! This is a motel, yes, so please don't expect the Ritz. The windows are not insulated so you will hear some street noise and the rooms are small. However, it's clean, has cool retro-styling with neon, the water pressure is great, and the free juice, coffee, muffins, etc. were all very good. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Serre-Chevalier

description: The hotel rents apartments too, some of them have sea view.
name: Hôtel Les Amandiers

reviews.author: Wallace Bode
reviews.content: We chose this hotel partly based upon the excellent ratings noted on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Customer service was excellent. From booking our reservation directly, to their reasonable dealings with us related to the recent hurricaine which arrived during our stay, to their going the extra mile to ship to us an item left behind in a room. Outstanding.

reviews.author: Lon Muller
reviews.content: This property offers terrific value and service. The price is right, the staff friendly and hospitable. The rooms are clean & up to date (if a bit on the small side; not a problem for most recreational visitors in New York). The AC was awesome; we like a cold room at night and NYC temperatures were over 100 degrees F during our stay. Wifi was free and problem free. One thing Doubletree does well is offer free breakfast (which was quite good). They will even let you forgo the buffet and cook an omelet for you. More important to me, as an early riser, they provided free coffee (upon request & with a voucher) in to-go cups so I could read the (free!) paper in the comfort of my room. Why is it that mid-priced hotels provided these nice perks but higher-line properties (at least in NYC) force me to search for coffee and paper every morning? Go figure. The immediate neighborhood left a little to be desired. There was a homeless man sleeping on the sidewalk next door to the hotel and 29th St. is a little dark at night, with little foot traffic.This left my wife feeling a little uneasy, however we were with another couple and did not feel threatened (safety in numbers). We spend 2 or 3 weekends per year in the city and I prefer neigborhoods with more activity in them, from both an entertainment and security point of view. Access to subways is OK, however East side subway service generally means more transfers to other parts of the city. We used cabs more that we usually do.

reviews.author: Gia Schmeler
reviews.content: Surprisingly for an NYC hotel, I have no complaints whatsoever. Stayed in a small ish room with a king bed which was fine and spacious enough. Perfect location close to the subway and just a walk away from times sq. Would definitely stay again. Should probably mention that I chose it off the back of an Expedia promotion so it probably felt better value because of that. In any case, the rooms are modern and very clean: rare for midtown.

title: St. Raphael

description: Torcroft Hotel is a stylish and friendly B&B. They have 11 rooms including 2 large balcony rooms, 2 deluxe double rooms, a family room and twins and doubles. All rooms are en-suite and have flat screen TVs. Free parking and Wi-Fi. Great breakfasts.
name: Torcroft Hotel

reviews.author: Alexis Abernathy
reviews.content: I have stayed in Key West many many times. This was, by far, the best hotel we have stayed at. The staff are the best, most courteous, overly helpful we have come across. The location can not be beat. To sit at the pool and watch all sorts of boats go by in the Gulf while sipping a nice cocktail is pricless. We found the prices at the hotel restaurant and pool bar very reasonable. We got upgraded to a junior suite with a gulf view which was magnificent. The room was huge and beautifully decorated. I could not recommend this hotel more highly and will find it hard to stay anywhere else in Key West again.

reviews.author: Lynn Berge
reviews.content: This is a perfect location in Key West at the very end of Duval next to Mallory Square where the sunset is celebrated every night. Almost all attractions are within a few minutes walk. We had an ordinary room but it was spacious and overlooked the ocean and Mallory Square. It had a King Size bed and sofa bed. The bathroom was good. The provided cosmetics are excellent. We had a good sized balcony overlooking Mallory Square. The service was good. We had no time to test the hotel facilities as there was so much to do in Key West. I would recommend the hotel without reservation.

reviews.author: Mrs. Maud Bergnaum
reviews.content: My wife and I stayed here the week between Christmas and New Years. We usually stay at 4 and 5 star hotels. This hotel has a 5 star price but it is a low to average 4 star property. There are other hotels in the same area that I would check out first before opting for Ocean Key. That being said, our suite was very nice with a great view of the ocean and Mallory Square. However, unless you get a room on the 5th floor your views of Mallory Square and the Ocean are likely to be obstructed by the ever growing palm trees. The bedroom had small non flat screen television not consistent with a 4 star property at 500 bucks a night. We did hear our neighbors from time to time. I think the walls could use some sound proofing. The staff, all young people under 30 were very helpful. The Hot Tin Roof, the hotel restaurant was outstanding. The Sunset Pier and Bar, also part of the hotel is a fantastic place with terrific live music. No question, you are in the center of the action at Ocean Key, I just didn't think it was worth the $2,200 for the 4 night we stayed there. There are other nice hotels nearby which have lower rates and which would still allow you to visit Mallory Square, view the ocean, hoist a view beers at the Sunset Pier and dine at the Hot Tin Roof.

reviews.author: Erick Heller
reviews.content: Ocean Key is in the center of the action and shopping in Key West. However, it is getting a little rough around the edges. In our room were 6 light dimmers, only 2 of which worked as they should. Floor tile in the room and hallways was scratched, chipped and scared. Closet was inconveniently located in the far back of the bathroom.

title: Torquay

address: 21 rue St Jean, 22450, La Roche Derrien
description: A former cotton mill on the banks of the River Jaudy in La Roche Derrien. Converted in 2007 into six wheelchair accessible apartments, all have level access showers with wheeled shower chairs. Ideal for disabled travellers.
name: I Need A Holiday Too

reviews.author: Adolph Spinka
reviews.content: Palace exceeded expectations! I recently stayed at the New York Palace for 5 nights during a shopping trip to NY with my daughter. We booked one of the newly renovated executive rooms with access to the executive club. On arrival the lobby was rather busy as it was for most of the duration of our stay but we were checked in almost immediately. We were allocated a room on the 31st floor with a terrific view of the cathedral and the city. The room was also bigger then we expected (especially by NY standards) but the bathroom was really quite small, and in my opinion not big enough for two people to share (for example there was only one sink, for a hotel of this calibre I would expect twin sinks). However, I would just point out that when the hotel says 'renovated' rooms I think they mean they have just installed new carpets and wall paper, as the furniture, linen, curtains etc. did not look too new, although overall the room was in very good condition. The beds were very comfortable and the room clean, however, on the second day we noticed a slight problem with out room in that certain areas of it had a slight smell if sick. We contacted reception making them aware of out problem and they were very apologetic and rather embarrassed at the problem and promptly moved us to a room on the 33rd floor with the same view. We only ever visited the executive club for breakfast so didn't really take full advantage of it, but the breakfast was superb and we made sure that when we did eat there we ate in large volumes! But if you plan on eating most of your meals in the hotel I agree with other reviewers that executive club access would be great value.The staff are very attentive and arrived almost immediately if we phoned to request something to our room, and made sure that all our needs (e.g. alternative bedding due to allergy to feathers) were taken care of. The concierges and doormen seemed helpful but were often very busy and I think it would probably be better if there were a few more of them around.The hotels location is just perfect for shopping, and apparently it is good for sight-seeing as well, but with so much shopping to be done we had more pressing activities to be completed.Overall, our stay at the Palace was great and I would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling to New York- We're looking forward to hopefully returning next year!

title: Trégor

description: Located on the most beautiful avenue in Val d'Isère, the Hotel with lounge bar, pro shop, spa, large lounge area with a fireplace and spacious bathrooms.
name: Hotel Avenue Lodge

reviews.author: Jude Heathcote
reviews.content: We stayed 4 nights in the Harbour Grand hotel on Hong Kong island at Easter 2012. We had a pleasant stay. It's a pricy hotel, but you get value for it. We are airline staff and they do give industry discounted prices for a room. Just write to the hotel and ask for it. The location: from the metro station Fortress Hill, it's a 5 minutes walk. The hotel is a bit hidden, but it's right on the boulevard. This boulevard is currently (april) under construction and there's a highway between the boulevard and the hotel. It would be a good idea to build a bridge or so over the highway for easy access, but I'm sure something like this should be part of the reconstruction plan already. We can't tell about the kitchen, as we didn't use it. There's many cheap breakfast options in the surrounding streets, which is a good option to save some money here. We used the bar on the top floor though. It is recommended to have at least one drink here at night to enjoy the spectacular view over Hong Kong harbour. The room is luxury, with good beds and a good bathroom. Be sure to book a room with harbour view on the higher floors! At night you can enjoy the wonderful Hong Kong light show from your own room. The only slightly disappointing issue was the pool... The reason why we chose this hotel out of many options was the pool, to be able to relax a little bit after a long touristic day in Hong Kong. But the water temperature was only 21 degr C.... Not inviting to stay in for longer than 5-10 minutes, despite the nice setting. That is too cold for a pool in a 5* star hotel, I would recommend to heat up the pool to a 27 degr C temperature year-round. Luckily they have a sauna and steam bath as well, so you can warm up afterwards. Overal: we had a nice stay here, but there are many good options in Hong Kong. We might try out another hotel next time :-) Wendy and Paul, the Netherlands

reviews.author: Wilburn Cummerata
reviews.content: Beautiful view from the room. Bed was super comfortable. Too bad the pool was under repair when we went, I was able to use their gym though. Location wise, it was convenient, a quick 2 minute walk to Fortress MTR station.

reviews.author: Rusty Dach
reviews.content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and upon arrival we upgraded to the Club room which was an excellent decision. Club room on 38th floor was well equipped (compact but sufficient) clean, well furnished and had all the things you could/would need plus a great view! The club lounge on the 41st floor was just great. Breakfast, tea and coffee all day, afternoon tea and alcoholic drinks 6-8pm and 5pm late check out on departure all included, all for approx. £60 extra per room, per night. Incredible value. Don't listen to reviews about the supposedly dodgy area, it is fine and a taxi in Central Hong Kong only costs about £4 so hardly an expensive ride! Alternatively there is the MTR close by which we didn't use as taxis were so cheap/accessible. Excellent gym, shame about the pool being out of action but to be honest there is so much to do in Hong Kong why would you sit by a pool!? All in all a fantastic hotel which I would not hesitate to use again. I have stayed at the Marriott right in the centre of Hong Kong and didn't find the Harbour Grand in any way inferior for being a few minutes further out.

reviews.author: Delta Skiles
reviews.content: Stayed here for 5 nights in November 2011, was a bit unsure of staying on Hong Kong Island as we had previously stopped in Kowloon (2009) and didnt venture over the harbour much, one day we visited this hotel as a member of our party knew someone who worked here. The street was a little off-putting as it is very "local" with garages and shops, the hotel look a little out of place as the reception is very luxourious. My in-laws stayed here in October 2011 and said how lovely it was so we decided to book it! So glad we did I would say after stopping in this hotel, we will definately be back! Upgraded to the Club lounge and the views from our room across the harbour were lovely. Club lounge is well worth the extra, daily breakfast, free drinks throughout the day, lunch time and evening nibbles and a fantastic view. Staff were lovely, always remember you and very friendly and helpful. Rooms nice and clean. Staff were sometimes a little slow at breakfast but we didnt let it bother us, just felt a bit bad asking! Close proximity to the MTR and we didnt feel at all intimidated by the locals around us, even late at night (as no-one seems to sleep here!) Didnt eat in the restaurant as we wanted to explore as we were only here a short while and the MTR makes it so easy to get around but the in-laws said it was very nice when they came. Looking forward to returning next year!

reviews.author: Miss Jany Rodriguez
reviews.content: Prior to our arrival we were upgraded to a Grand Deluxe Harbourview Room as the swimming pool was closed. I hate to think what our original room would have been like, as with two suitcases and handbaggage there wasn't an awful lot of spare room. The harbour view was only partial, and there was quite a lot of building work going on below us. Fortunately most of our stay was over Chinese New Year so it didn't cause us much bother, but you really noticed it on the last day when everybody was back at work. If you are spending time on Hong Kong Island this hotel has easy access to the MTR which made getting about fairly easy, even though several stops away from Central. Room and harbour views nowhere near as good as the Harbour Grand Kowloon, which we stayed at last time we were in Hong Kong, but more than made up for with its easy access to the MTR without the need of a shuttle bus.

reviews.author: Alisha Gleichner
reviews.content: The hotel is nice but the rooms are very small (think London small). The lobby is very sterile and has no lobby bar or restaurant . This hotel in my opinion is basically a convention hotel. The staff were very friendly and the service was good. One thing you should know is the location of this hotel is very bad. It is located in an old 1960's residential neighborhood. There is plenty of local food around but it is not really a tourist area. The hotel is located on a road called "Oil Can Road" which is appropriate considering there are car repair shops located next to the hotel. These shops stay open late. The MTR is located about 3 blocks away. If you are coming as a tourist I would not recommend this hotel because you have to hop on the MTR to go anywhere.

reviews.author: Hyman Reichert
reviews.content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I would say this is a good 4 star hotel. I am hesitant to say this is a 5 star hotel because although it looks like a 5 star hotel, it did not feel like a heavy weight 5 star hotel. There were quick free shuttle buses to/from the HK station of the Airport express trains. Service was good but erratic. For example, I ordered the standard Yang Chow Fried Rice for room service. It was way too greasy…can you imagine fried rice with an inch thick of oil at the bottom of the rice? Not exaggerating….after leaving the unfinished rice outside the room for pick up and having written negative comments about it on the napkin, although the item “Private Dining – Room” was reflected on the bill, the cost (without me asking for it) was zero. Great initiative. What was erratic was the newspaper….firstly, they did not ask me whether I preferred English or Chinese papers. Secondly, it was only delivered on the 1st day and they forgot about it for the next 4 days! Finally, there was window cleaning/replacement going on so the ropes from the gondola were constantly knocking against the room’s windows (even late at night). This was not mentioned upon check-in. So although a room change was offered after I inquired about what was going on, it was rather late because I have unpacked and it was late at night. What gave it a 5 star look: a big sized lobby; there was also a musician playing harp in the lobby in evenings…soothing; good sized restaurant for breakfast , did not feel crammed. Nice looking hotel pool too overlooking the harbor. There was a good Business Centre too but a pity that the person behind the counter did not even know how to arrange for a DHL package to be picked up. Why it did not feel like a heavy weight 5 star hotel: weird location. The surroundings are rather run down with no trendy shops to speak off however there is a 7-11, 2 supermarkets and MTR station (Fortress Hill) is a short walk away though. It is not conveniently located i.e. From Fortress Hill. It is a few MTR stops to Admiralty (which you will need to get off in order to get to change MTR to Tsim Tsa Tsui). Suggestion: get the free shuttle buses from the hotel if it takes you to where you want to go (they go to Causeway Bay, Admiralty, Central). Slow elevators in Hotel. Made worse by large tour groups jostling for the elevators. If not too much more expensive, suggest getting a room from 28/F upwards. You will get to use elevators in a different elevator bank from those that tour groups use (they appear to generally use rooms up to 27/F). If you are after good sized rooms (by HK standards), want to feel comfortable in a large hotel with modern amenities, are not bothered too much by its location and its surroundings, and can live with service that does not go the extra mile, and cost is important (it is slightly cheaper than others more conveniently located hotels in the same class) I would say this is a good choice.

reviews.author: Kayden Hagenes V
reviews.content: I had always wanted to visit HK and pushed the boat out for our Silver Wedding. Like others we opted to upgrade to the Club Room and found ourselves on the 39th floor. The views alone are worth the extra cost. Be sure and ask for a west facing room as you get the aspect out to Hong Kong centre and Kowloon. From the lounge the views are fantastic both during the day and evening when you have front row seats to the lights show at 8.00pm. The staff in the lounge make a real effort to look after you. A real 5 star experience. We found the best way to get around during the day was the metro/underground using Fortress Hill which is only 3 stops from central. I have never felt so safe on an underground system as I did there. We did also go on Star Ferry, buses, taxis and trams as well. On speaking to other tourists on a trip to the Buddha we realised that the compromise of very central v views was worth paying as others didn't have any view out of their hotel due to the built up area nature of the City. The open top bus tour was also an excellent way to find out about HK. We also went to see the Pandas at Ocean Park Theme Park and went on the cable car ride which gave great views over Aberdeen, Stanley and Repulse Bay. The night market in Kowloon was well worth a visit giving you a chance to experience the "in your face" Hong Kong. Once again 20/25 minutes back on the metro. Don't bother with the airport transfer which takes around 70 minutes as you are last hotel on the stop, get a taxi as it costs around the same 350HK$ or take the train and then taxi. Always write down where you are going as sometimes the taxi drivers can't understand what you are saying.

reviews.author: Ryan Hahn
reviews.content: Harbour Grand Hong Kong is a good value and modern hotel with spacious, comfortable and well-quipped rooms. The hotel isn't amongst all of the hustle and bustle at Central, Causeway Bay or Wan Chai, however it is a 5 minute walk from the Fortress Hill MTR Station (which is quick, cheap and frequent enough to commute to Hong Kong's major districts with minimal fuss every day) and there are some nice street markets just up the road. I stayed here for a week over New Years and found it to be a great location. Although there isn't a major shopping district around the hotel, there are still the essentials: Mannings, Wellcome supermarket, 7-11, McDonalds (with McCafe - good value coffee in Hong Kong!) and a Starbucks so you will never be without food nor caffeine. I found the Harbour Grand to be significantly cheaper and more spacious than other hotels that are closer to Central and Causeway bay. For me, staying here for a week the financial savings and larger room definitely outweighed the (slightly) out of the way location.

title: Val-d'Isère

description: Charming 3* hotel in a park with duplex or standard rooms all with private terraces. The facilities include a very good Provençal restaurant (c. 25€ to 50€/person), a large outdoor heated pool and a spa with a big indoor pool with water jets, a steam room and fitness equipment. This hotel is very quiet.
name: Hotel Cantemerle

reviews.author: Dr. Zita Rogahn
reviews.content: I went there with my husand, sister & brother in law, who had flown in from Chicago. We were staying in San Francisco and going for several hours of pampering. First impression driving in: This CAN'T be it! It's a motel and looks like something you would find in the middle of nowwhere on a road trip. We were led into a dressing room of sorts and told to disrobe, put our personal belongs into a mesh hanging bag and put on a robe. The robes were a joke and did not appear to have been washed. We then had to drag our stuff in the hanging bag into the mud room. While the mud bath felt good, it was hard not to think about how many others I was bathing with if you know what I mean. We were then ushered into another room with our hanging bag for a blanket wrap where an old wool type blanket was thrown over us. When that was over, rather than just keeping us in the same where we've been relaxing, we are then led to another room, still dragging our stuff around, into the massage room. Apparently 2 out of 2 us got good massages while the other two recieved the worst massage we've ever had. Both of us were asked what our trouble spots were by the masseuse, who then completely disregarded what we said. I told my masseuse to feel free to "dig in" and I was told that was not the kind of massage she was giving me, that what I was getting is for people who are paralyzed, stroke victims, etc. What???!! The place was dark & dingy, appeared unclean and the $388 per couple + tips could have been better spent at a real spa and resort. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.author: Marcel Bernhard
reviews.content: Hubby and I went for a couples spa package last weekend for my 40th bday last weekend. What fun! My husband was really worried about the mud bath (he's a clean freak), but even he found it relaxing, comfortable, and fun. I would do the mud bath again - I think he is fine having done it ONCE in his life. I wasn't sure what to expect, having heard tales from others of attendants shoveling hot mud over you while you lay in the mud, and then being sprayed w/power hoses to get the mud off. Nothing could be further from the truth! The attendant tells you what to do, and then leaves you to get in/out of the mud while she's out of the room. She puts cool towels on your forehead, applies a soothing face mask, and explains what the mud is all about and answers questions. After around 15 min in the mud, she returns to tell you to get out, rinse off (there's a curtained-off area, with 2 showers - one for each of you, with a stone bench to sit on if you like) and then you hop in to the jacuzzi, where you relax while drinking cool lemon water. From there, go to the cool-down room, where you're swaddled like a baby in a room with candles, a gurgling water feature, and new age music (which I would normally hate, but didn't mind becuase I was so relaxed). We had 30 minute massages, which were fabulous! I recommend Marcia - who massaged my husband. I think he got a better treatment than I did... though I was happy w/my masseuse (forgot name). We were given a mesh bag to keep our clothes/shoes clean/dry, and $@!#%-flops to walk around in. This seems contrary to what a previous poster mentioned. Golden Haven isn't the top of the line place, but for $108 each (check out online coupons), the 90 minute experience was a great value and a completely fun, relaxing experience. I want to return w/a friend or two. NOTE - don't go winetasting first - we were so glad we hadn't done so! All the heat of the mud and jacuzzi is dehydrating and would be uncomfortable if you had been drinking.

reviews.author: Josefina Friesen
reviews.content: We travelled to Golden Haven filled with trepidation, having read unfair reports in the trip advisor. I fell off my bicycle and broke my hip and was craving healing waters and mineral mud,so we decided to take a jacuzzi room and enjoy the waters come what may. We were delighted to find a pleasant room, spotlessly clean and equipped with small fridge, bottled water, tea, coffee and candy and plentiful fluffy towels and wash cloths. The room was remarkably quiet, tucked away from the main drag, with leafy trees. The staff were very pleasant and the spa facilities excellent. Yes, it's a motel, but you're not paying "Four seasons" prices. Especially in the off season, I think we had excellent value for money and the person who mentioned the smell must be unaccustomed to natural sulphur smells from all mineral springs. In fact, I was hardly aware of it, maybe because we took a perfumed candle. So, if you want a reasonably priced, clean, quiet spa experience and you're not a snob, go for Golden Haven. J.C.

reviews.author: Fay Wolff
reviews.content: The Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa was a delightful getaway from the rat race. We had a romantic evening in our room which had a huge jacuzzi tub filled with mineral water and fragrant bath salts. We enjoyed breakfast and shopping in the quaint town of Calistoga the next day and then were treated to a fabulously relaxing massage and facial. The staff was wonderful and attentive and I ended the weekend with a totally rejuvenated body and renewed spirit and soul. It is a lovely way to get away from it all...there is an outdoor pool and spa, sunbathing, areas for quiet picnics or group gatherings. I highly recommend a visit.

reviews.author: Maybell Miller
reviews.content: My husband and I found Golden Haven on the Internet and didn't know anyone who had been to this spa so we had our fingers crossed that our 10th anniversary trip to the Napa Valley would pair well with our stay at Golden Haven. It's a little off the main street and we thought we'd taken wrong turn at first, but from the moment of check-in until we left, it was a completely relaxing, self-indulgent experience that we hope to repeat this summer. We stayed in the jacuzzi room and it was wonderful to soak right before going to bed and first thing in the morning. We had signed up for the couples mud bath and giggled like kids when we were left alone to wriggle down into the mud. It was heaven! We both dozed off (easy after a day of visiting wineries) but the hot spring fed mud bath was extremely relaxing and hot enough for my "make me sweat" husband who figured out how to move around to increase the temperature around him. I like a little cooler than he does so I simply didn't move and found the temperature of the mud to be perfect. We washed off, soaked in the jacuzzi and headed for our heated blanked wrap (nap time again) and then an hour long-massage. We had plans of going out for dinner afterwards, but felt so great that we went back to our room and stayed there for the rest of the night. The facilities were clean, the people were friendly and we saw several relaxed, happy people walking around the spa. We highly recommend Golden Haven for your next visit to the area.

reviews.author: Ellie Altenwerth
reviews.content: We had a TERRIBLE experience at this spa. Admittedly we were 10 minutes late for our appointment for a couples mud bath and massage, but we did not feel the treatment we received was called for. The reception staff were unfriendly and unprofessional. They acted as if they were exasperated and seem inconvenienced at having to wait on us. We felt exteremly unwelcome. We had signed up for an hour mud bath and an hour massage at a promotional rate. Because we were 10 minutes late, our massage time had to be cut in half. Thankfully, we were charged a pro-rated promotional rate. However, the relatively inexpensive price was no consolation for very poor service. In fact, after the entire experience we still felt as though we had been "ripped off." We did not know what to expect with the mud bath, as it was our first experience. This part of our spa treatment seemed very rushed. Our attendant seemed somewhat friendly, but seemed to push us through each of the stages of the mud bath, mineral soak and blanket wrap as though we were in a race. The actual soak time in the mud was about 10 minutes, which we heard, after some research, is probably the shortest soak time alloted amongst all the other spas in Calistoga. During the blanket wrap, we were supposed to retire or even nap in relaxing silence. And despite a sign posted right outside the room requesting quiet, we heard loud laughing and talking the whole time, which made it extremely difficult to fall asleep let alone relax. Our half hour massage was probably the best part of our experience, although that is not saying much. The massage therapists greeted us and bid us farewell very hastily. However, the massage was fairly good, but definitely not near the best we've had. (Perahps we are a bit biased in this opinion because we were already pretty upset by this point.) Overall, we had a very disappointing experience, especially since we had been looking forward to it for a while. We both felt a lot LESS relaxed coming out of the spa than we did going in! We kept joking that what we needed now was a massage since we felt a bit stressed! We would definitely not recommend this spa to anyone. It is much more worth your while to pay a little extra to get much better service. After our very disheartening experience, we went shopping around at several other spas in Calistoga. It seemed like common knowledge among the locals that Golden Haven has a reputation for providing rushed, unfriendly service and for "herding" their large numbers of customers through their spa experiences. In some cases, all we had to mention was that we had an extremely poor spa experience and people guessed exactly where we were talking about. That is pretty bad! If friendly, welcoming, accomodating service is essential to you to have a good experience, please do not waste your time here! In spite of the many positive reviews this spa has received, we definitely encourage you to shop around and get a feel for what the locals' opinions are. We think that you will find that every spa will recommend itself, but the good spas will also have some recommendations for other good spas in the area and will have a strong opinion as to where NOT to go, which will be.......take a guess!!! We hope you have a better experience than ours wherever you decide to go!

title: Vence

description: The Eldorado, a former ''maison de rendez-vous'', was once home to the kept women of the 19th century bourgeois. Now a very cute ''no'' star hotel, its charm more than makes up for what it lacks in amenities (who needs a TV in Paris anyway?). The  staff are super friendly, the décor is garage sale chic, and there's a lovely courtyard that fills with neighbourhood hipsters on warm evenings. It also has a very good location and you can easily avoid the noise of Pigalle or Montmartre's high prices, but they're within stumble distance if you decide to explore. For early risers breakfast (€5, until 10:00) is served in the attached restaurant/bar. Some English spoken, especially for those who pet the cat sprawled across the reception desk.
name: Hotel Eldorado

reviews.author: Wilfred Welch
reviews.content: Pros, Cons  My husband  I just returned from a weekend at Club Med Punta Cana. It was our first Club Med experience.Pros: The weather was wonderful, the beach excellent. Water in the Carribean in Jan is not warm, but it is ok, once you get used to it. The bread in the restaurants was excellent, you have to try the chocolate bread!Neutrals: The food was tolerable. I do not eat seafood, and that is a big problem at Club med. They even put tuna on their pizzas! Yes, they always had beef or chicken, but it was not what you would find in an average american restaurant. There was an abundance of fruit at every meal, which I ate  had no problem with. I also drank a lot of sodas with ice from the bars and had no problem with the water. We did not take our teenagers with us, but they would have been unhappy with the menus. The hotdogs  hamburgers that they offer would not have been eaten by my kids-I tried the hotdog, and I wouldn't eat it either.Rooms were adequate, not luxurious, but very clean with lots of closet space. They have a small refrigerator that doesn't cool very well and 2 small safes, neither of which would lock properly. Negatives: If you don't speak french, don't expect to make a lot of new friends, don't expect to be seated with english speaking guests at dinner. My guess is that 90% of guests were french. With this comes topless sunbathing  thong bikinis; If this bothers you, you might consider another resort. Kids: Looks like a great kids club for those parents that wanted to spend the $ to enroll their children. Most children were in the infant to 6yr age group. That means at every meal there were screaming children, crying babies, and parents who have never heard of disciplining their children. While at the pool, there were a number of toddlers around the deep end of the pool with no adult close by. At the beach, there were unsupervised children galore, and I wonder why children don't end up getting hurt, since their parents don't seem to watch them very well. Dress ran the gamut from semi formal to ultra casual at all meals, but casual was the norm.Hints: If you want to spend time in the sun, wear your swimsuit to breakfast with a cover-up, and on your way to the restaurant, deposit your sunglasses, towels, books etc in a lounge chair. If you eat first, then go back to your room to change, there will not be any chairs left. On the beach, avoid the white plastic chairs, they are not as comfortable as the blue.You are expected to check out by 11, but club med provides wonderful changing rooms with lockers, showers, towels etc., so you can check out, put your carryon in the locker  then go to the beach until your afternoon departure. Don't depend on the airport transfers being included, even though it says so in your papers from your travel agent. We waited an hour at the airport trying to get transportation to the resort, and on the way home, had to pay for a taxi, since suddenly, there were no english speaking GO's around. Taxi is $10 each way to the airport, so plan ahead! It was an enjoyable getaway, but I would have to say that I would certainly book a 7 day carribean cruise before I would spend a week at this resort.

reviews.author: Allie Boehm DDS
reviews.content: Cet endroit est 脿 mes yeux Paradisiaque le Club super   showReview(6752390, 'full');

reviews.author: Judge Johns
reviews.content: We spent one night after our cruise at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino, we had a corner duel balcony room on the seventh floor, with an amazing view of the beautiful beach. It was a great way to finish our cruise and prepare to come back to reality. The room was clean and spacious, the bed was extremely comfortable, the staff was polite and helpful. I won $10 in their casino and was able to view my cruise photos on the flat screen tv with the interface they provided from my laptop. It was a fantastic visit!

reviews.author: Laurel Wiegand
reviews.content: I tussled between average and very good for my overall rating because there was nothing that wowed me about my stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort - in fact there were more things that pushed my stay toward average than very good. Let me explain... CHECK-IN: We arrived early (well before 4:00 PM check-in) on Monday, April 2nd. I was very happy the front desk was able to accomodate us early but not so happy that the front desk clerk seemed a little robotic and a tad bit unfriendly. I'm never expecting cartwheels but actually looking up at me as you're speaking to me and a smile would be nice. ROOM: We get to our room and it's typical full-service Marriott - comfy bed, too soft pillows, typical amenities, the usual. On the upside, the room was airy and clean (except for the hair left behind on the bathroom floor), there was a fridge and the partial ocean view from our "city view" room was a definite plus! HOTEL AREA: If you're visiting Puerto Rico looking for a rich, historical and cultural experience be sure to rent a car and venture far from the Condado area and this San Juan Marriott. This area of San Juan felt more like South Beach Miami to me. It wasn't until I ventured out of the area that I felt like was in Puerto Rico. High-rise condominiums, Starbucks, Walgreens, Fuddruckers, Pizzeria Uno's, Wendy's, Chili's are all within walking distance from the hotel (all of which I can get at home) -which brings me to my review... FOOD: We ate breakfast at La Vista in the hotel and honestly, the best thing about this restaurant was our server Senora Clarimar and perhaps the view (running a distant second). Clarimar was genuinely friendly, she was sweet and extremely helpful with guiding us on what to see in Old San Juan and other parts of Puerto Rico. The ONLY reason we chose to eat there a second time was because of her and the wonderful service she provided. Otherwise, skip it!!! La Vista is drastically overpriced (buffet 24.95 pp) and the food was edible but not great. As we took an early morning walk around the neighborhood one day, we noticed a few local spots serving breakfast for much less. Take the walk and save a bunch! GETTING AROUND: We rented a car which I definitely suggest. I bought my GPS along which I HIGHLY recommend. GPS may not be as reliable in PR since road changes accur so often but it's good to have and a general guide. One morning before heading off to the rainforest (which I'll review seperately) we stopped to ask the concierge for directions. Without looking up, she handed me a pre-printed direction card and sent me on my way. ***SIGH*** HOTEL ACTIVITIES: We didn't spend a great deal of time at the pool so a review wouldn't be fair. I can say that there's an activity board posted daily so check that for what's happening around the pool. Included as "justification" for your hefty 16% resort fee is a one hour two bike rental. Use it! The pre-printed resort fee "justification" card says one bike, two hours but Senora Rita at the activities desk quickly made the correction for us. One note of caution, when biking on the streets in the area BE CAREFUL - drivers in PR are unforgiving! CHECK-OUT: I didn't wait long to check out and was disappointed I had to wait at all. The in-room express check-out wasn't working. I stay at Marriott properties because, for the most part, I know what to expect. Some stays I am wowed and that's because of the people and service. This Marriott did not WOW me and I'm not sure I'd stay here again.

title: Wikivoyage:Listings

description: The Eldorado, a former ''maison de rendez-vous'', was once home to the kept women of the 19th century bourgeois. Now a very cute ''no'' star hotel, its charm more than makes up for what it lacks in amenities (who needs a TV in Paris anyway?). The  staff are super friendly, the décor is garage sale chic, and there's a lovely courtyard that fills with neighbourhood hipsters on warm evenings. It also has a very good location and you can easily avoid the noise of Pigalle or Montmartre's high prices, but they're within stumble distance if you decide to explore. For early risers breakfast (€5, until 10:00) is served in the attached restaurant/bar. Some English spoken, especially for those who pet the cat sprawled across the reception desk.
name: Hotel Eldorado

reviews.author: Ludie Walter
reviews.content: We stay here for three days before our cruise. We were excited to be back at this hotel but to our surprise we were very disappointed. The grounds were not like they were when we stayed here before. The food quality wasn't superb like before. The room we stayed in on the 5th floor, ocean front had many red ants that bit us up. It was horrible. We complained about this situation and the management didn't even care. What happened to this wonderful place!!!

reviews.author: Eda Dooley
reviews.content: The hotel itself is a pretty standard "Western Hotel Chain" 4 star. Everything was good, so I'll just mention the problems/suggestions. When my girlfriend and I arrived Tuesday night at 7pm our room wasn't ready, so in response they offered us "free drinks at the bar while we wait", so we thought that was appropriate given check-in is 4pm. Finally at 8:30pm, our room was ready. Our room had a partial Ocean view, facing east 15th floor. The balcony view was great but the problem was that the bathroom was sooo small! I mean I have stayed at hotels with closets bigger than that! We learned to live with it though. The room itself was small too - I have stayed at hotels with bathrooms larger than that room, lol. We booked a deal for $150/night while the published rate was $300/night. I'd be pretty pissed if I'd have paid that for the room that we had. The other problem was with housekeeping. We stayed 9 nights, and they didn't change our sheets the entire time! I knew this because the first night my girlfriend's makeup smudged on the sheets and it was still there when we checked out. We only ate at the beach bar and the food was pretty good, maybe a little overpriced, but not by much. In the end, we found that it was actually a great hotel for just relaxing by the beach all day, which caused us to simply forgive the hotel for its obvious issues.

reviews.author: Raymond King
reviews.content: The Marriott was a great place to stay in Puerto Rico, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the facilities were lovely. My only disappointments were that the room was musty and nothing would dry, even when the AC was on. It is unpleasant to have to put on a damp bathing suit the next morning! Also, the spa facilities were a disappointment - I tried to schedule a pedicure, but there was very limited availability for services, so I had to go without. I also wish the hot tub was bigger - it was often full of folks, and so unavailable to me.

reviews.author: Courtney Konopelski
reviews.content: Hotel location excellent for eating, shopping,and short taxi ride to Old San Juan. The hotel staff was the most accommodating, helpful group of personnel I have ever seen in 1 hotel at the same time. Friendly "good mornings" like we were old friends. Definite return trip in the future.

title: Wikivoyage:Listings

description: Spacious suites with fireplace next to the Chateau Beynac.
name: Balcon en Foret
price: high season: €95-125; low season: min stay 2 nights

reviews.author: Vernon Schmeler
reviews.content: We stayed at this hotel last week for 3 nights. What gracious service and hospitality! The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. Catie Copley, the Canine Ambassador, is a warm, welcoming face after a hard day of site seeing. The rooms are clean and fairly spacious with comfortable, well-appointed beds. The bathroom was way too small to maneuver about comfortably. However, it's a lovely hotel, right in the heart of the action. Would I return? In a heart beat!

reviews.author: Jarrod Rolfson
reviews.content: Clean, well located, fantastic old bar. Go to hotel for me when in Boston. Not small or quaint but very upscale functional.

reviews.author: Jennyfer Toy
reviews.content: We have now stayed twice at this Hotel both times we were visiting for New Years Eve (First Night) celebrations. This hotel is ideal for this as the parade comes around Copley plaza where the hotel is situated. The rooms were very well equipped and we were given a free upgrade which gave us a separate lounge area. We didn't eat in the Hotel so can't comment on the food but we did go in the Oak room for cocktails and drinks. This is a very cosy place to sit and enjoy a drink or two. Would recommend this hotel to anybody

reviews.author: Morton Paucek
reviews.content: Have stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza before so I knew the hotel would meet all my expectations. Spent the 4th of July night there and was checked in promptly with no issues. One negative (though minor but still rare for a top notch hotel like the Copley Plaza) was that the staff was not attentive when we walked in with bags. No attempt to help us and even after checking in ... no attempt to bring our bags up to our room (the front desk didn't even ask if we had bags and if we needed help). It's an oversight worth noting (even though I am very capable of handling my own bag) because you would not expect this and never experienced it prior. The room was laid out perfectly and plenty of space. Another minor thing that completely stood out was the half empty bottle of water just sitting on the table. Big oversight for a first rate hotel (and a bit gross since it leads you to question how thorough they clean). The room did appear clean though and the bed was comfortable. Ordered room service and it came up promptly and hit the spot. We ordered extra towels and said we would be leaving the room and to leave them on the bed. No one delivered them. We called again and eventually got them upon our return. The small "misses" are noted because of the hotel wanting to be a 5 star facility and my prior experience being so positive. Had breakfast the next day in the Oak Room and it was excellent.

reviews.author: Marielle Braun
reviews.content: We spent a full weekend in the hotel. It has pluses and minuses, but overall our impression was more on the negative side. On the positive side: - the location was very good - the bedding was nice - the bathroom was also reasonably nice On the negative side: - the doors have no insulation whatsoever. We could see the hallway lights under the door directly from the bed, and could hear everything - the tv did not work well, and repeated inquiries were useless - $7 for a bottle of water ? $15/day for internet access ? Most hotels include these amenities for free.

reviews.author: Lazaro Cummerata
reviews.content: We were there for a wedding (in the hotel itself). The rooms were really nothing special. Even with an event discount, a 2 night stay for 2 was close to $700.00. Parking was not included even though we were guests at the hotel. We liked the location; though if we were not there for the wedding, we would probably stayed at a hotel in a different location

reviews.author: Madeline Robel
reviews.content: Fairmont Copley Plaza staff is an outstanding array of professionals. All great you by your name with a smile.

reviews.author: Derick Fadel
reviews.content: First - great location. You are located 1 block from Newbury avenue, for great shopping, and minutes from the Copley Mall. If you are looking for a 'Boston' experience, then you have a great location and very nice hotel. The downside - The hotel is not great for kids or for folks looking for a lot of space. The rooms are beautiful, but small and really ornate. You are across the street from the Westin and can easily enter the entire Copley system (i.e. no need to walk in the snow to reach the mall and other Copley hotels). My kids love Katie (the Copley mascot) and the great people. The gold level is very nice and the gold level concierge, breakfast, and evening cocktails are great. The rooms just feel a bit tired, so I'll probably look for other options (maybe Fairmont Battery Warf, Nine Zero on Beacon Hill, or the Intercontintental on the waterfront)

reviews.author: Kendrick Greenholt
reviews.content: This hotel is typical of the Fairmont chain: A hotel run by professionals, with friendly but not intrusive staff, good food and drinks in the restaurants, and nicely decorated and clean rooms. You can walk from the hotel to the Museum of Fine Arts, Northeastern University, the Prudential Center, Symphony Hall, the Public Garden, the Common, and good shopping. If you want to go farther afield, there are T stations nearby. All in all, what an urban hotel should be: a convenient refuge when one has had enough of the city.

title: Beynac-et-Cazenac

description: The view from the hotel is magnificent and the service is impeccable.
name: Le Logis du Chateau

reviews.author: Rodrigo Sauer
reviews.content: Culebra is a quiet island, a place to relax, a place to enjoy sunshine, beaches, and snorkeling. We have enjoyed visiting Culebra eight times, staying at Tamarindo Estates the last six times. A special place to which we will surely return. Tamarindo Estates is a modest, well-maintained, gated refuge. The twelve house-keeping units are small but adequate---simple but clean. The kitchens are OK for breakfasts and lunches; we have not tried to cook dinners. The terraces provide spectacular views of sunsets and starry, night-time skies. The management is friendly and responsive to all requests. The Tamarindo Estates private waterfront is broken coral, not sand, and access to the water is difficult (enter at the north end), but once in one finds wonderful snorkeling (turn south, left, along the outer edge of the coral heads). A quarter-mile walk distant is Tamarindo Beach, which provides sand and easy access for less spectacular snorkeling. Difficult to reach Carlos Rosario Beach may offer snorkeling better or equal to that at Tamarindo Estates, but there is no other equal on the island or perhaps elsewhere in the Caribbean. Also on the Tamarindo Estates waterfront is a small, well-maintained, fresh-water swimming pool. A Jeep is essential on Culebra. We have rented from Carlos. Three colmados in town provide adequate grocery selections. Restaurants change from year to year, with Mamacitas, Dinghy Dock, and Barbara Rosaâ€™s perennial and enduring favorites. Flamenco Beach is spectacular. It is crowded on weekends, as is much of the island, which makes one appreciate even more the privacy of Tamarindo Estates. We have stayed on Belize, Bonaire, Saint Vincent, and Puerto Ricoâ€™s big island. Culebra tops all, and Tamarindo Estates is in our opinion the best place to stay on Culebra.

reviews.author: Brionna Wyman
reviews.content: Tamarindo Estates is a beautiful property with very cute villas. The villas were extremely clean and well-equipped with everything we needed to be comfortable. From the porch you have amazing views of the ocean and surrounding islands. The private beaches at Tamarindo were easy to get to and very clean. Jose and Luis were very friendly and helpful. This is an excellent place to stay for any traveler.

title: Vaison-la-Romaine

description: Area for motor homes, rents mobile homes and caravans.
name: Municipal area Motorhome

reviews.author: Stewart Olson
reviews.content: We are from New York and traveled to Puerto Rico for a family reunion and decided to do it at Tamarindo Estates. Each little apartment kitchen had everything we needed from dishwashing soap in the kitchen, pots and pans, paper towels and the bathrooms were clean and wer also equiped with soap, shampoo and conditioner. Each small apartment has a balcony with tables and chairs. There is a shower outside to clean up before going to the apartment. There is a barbecue pit in front of the villas with tables. The place was clean and comfortable. The walk to the beach is a long one but once you get there the view is fabulous. The pool is a good size and the pool house is equipmed with bathrooms and shower. The beach house has tables and you can also barbecue there. The property manager was very helpful and was always there when we needed him. Adults and kids enjoyed the place. The best snorkling in the island is right in front of this property, we found out it is a natural reserve. The only problem we found is that you must bring your food supplies from the main island or be prepared to pay the prices of culebra. They do not have supermarkets but small stores. We found everything we needed but not always in the same place. Make sure that you rent a jeep (we did) or you will not be able to move around at wish. We did find that taxi drivers are easy to find and during off hours if you make previous arrangements they will pick you up and wait for you to take you back to the hotel. There are many restaurants in town. Recommendations: The most beautiful beach is Flamenco beach - a taxi ride away. You can walk it but there are no side walks and you can not always see the cars coming so we decided it was safer to drive there. There you will find kiosks with food and beverages. Make sure you get your ferry tickets early as they sold out fast and be on line at least an hour before if you are traveling with luggage. There is a car transport that works from Monday to Friday, if you want to take your car from the mainland a reservation is needed but it does not work on Saturday and Sundays. All and all we will do it again. If what you are looking is a quiet, peaceful place full of nature. This is it. We are ready to do it again..

title: Vaison-la-Romaine

description: Water park, rentals of mobile homes.
name: Le Carpe Diem (camping)
title: Vaison-la-Romaine

description: 3-star hotel. Themed stays are available in history or oenology. Languages ​​spoken: English, German, Italian.
name: Hostellerie du Beffroi

reviews.author: Eryn Becker
reviews.content: We just got back from a week at Tamarindo Estates and had one of the best vacations ever! The villa was spotless, the staff helpful, friendly and charming, the jeep was perfect for our needs and the island of Culebra was alittle bit of heaven. We had a great time snorkeling, sunning, reading, hiking. The residents of the island were friendly and courteous. It was fabulous!

reviews.author: Robbie Pacocha
reviews.content: Great choice of hotel. My sister had a wedding and her and fiancÃ© checked out few places to suggest. 5 or 6 couples / singles stayed here. We had 6 nights, greeted by Suzanna and shown around, so we knew lay of the hotel. Rooms were large enough and comfortable. Walk- in large shower. Nice to have assortment of beach chairs provided. Beach towels provided. Perfect sandy beach with fun to play in ocean waves. Separate entrance when we came from beach, and used shower to remove sand on feet. Spent lots of time in large jacuzzi, with family members and friends: perfect temperature. Front desk always got us taxi service within 5-10 minutes. We also took bus into Old San Juan about 2 blocks away (#21 & 53). Convenient location. On last day with 11am checkout, we left bags, stayed at beach, and used shower on 4th floor before heading to airport. We highly recommend.

reviews.author: Brenden Ullrich
reviews.content: We checked into this hotel on Tuesday Evening January 10,2012. I have to say that it was the worst experience ever. We had reservations at "A Wind Chimes" hotel and were told they did not have our reservation but we could stay at their sister hotel, Acacia. We were told at ten o,clock at night to carry our bags down the very dark street to the Acacia. Wait a moment, we were booked at one hotel and switched to another. For two weary travelers it was to much to comprehend and we trudged to the Acacia. Beware upon arrival they slam you with there rules one of which is you can not get your money back if the room does not meet your expectations. I awoke to having a severe allergic reaction which I recognized instantly as being the result of the presence of mold. My husband investigated and found considerable mold in the bathroom and air conditioner. My husband and I agreed that we could not remain at the hotel. We expressed our desire to leave the hotel to the desk clerk who referred the matter to her manager.The manager was a very rude women who in no uncertain terms advised us that we had booked a four night stay and if we desired to leave we would be charged for a three night stay. To our shock, the problems my wife was having with the mold in the room WERE COMPLETELY IGNORED!!! We left the hotel very bitter and completely resentful of the way we were treated. So beware if you should become ill or have an emergency you will be in for the three night stay rule.

title: Vaison-la-Romaine

description: In the city centre, pets allowed.
name: Hotel Burrhus

reviews.author: Jayde Braun
reviews.content: We stayed at Acacia for 3 nights for our first trip to Puerto Rico. This place is gorgeous! Spanish architecture with multi-levels and walkways between rooms. The director and all of the other staff were so accommodating. They help with anything you need (cabs, places to go, etc) and are on a first name basis. Our king room was a perfect size with a large tv and private bath (all of them have private bathes) and the bed was comfy with soft, light linens. We read reviews about kings being two twins stuck together, but that was not the case. Our room had a private back balcony, but many of them had front balconies overlooking the HUGE hot tub. The tub is amazing to say the least. It's the largest one in San Juan with jets everywhere and two waterfalls. The view from the pool and most balconies is a partial oceanview. The tall tower The hotel is so close to the beach, which is great for walking back easily. Pamela's on the beach is just east (a 10 minute beach walk) where you can eat in the sand. They have outdoor showers to rinse off, towels and cucumber/fruit water available in the lobby, and on the ground level is this delicious restaurant called Niche ... let's just say the food is unbelievable. Best meal in San Juan. Some tips to note to travelers: this is not a cookie cutter resort with all of the amenities. What you get with this place is a cozy, comfy little getaway. It is on the east end of Condado, so a bit away from the happening bars and restaurants and a bit further from Old San Juan. However, its close enough for long walks or short cab rides and is worth the peacefulness, service, food, and beach location! There is a really cool deli (Kasalta - that President Obama visited) and other restaurants to the east that are easy to walk to from Acacia. We highly recommend this place and expect to stay again in the near future.

reviews.author: Adeline Pfeffer
reviews.content: You wake up one day and decide to take a trip to Puerto Rico. You surf the internet - you read the reviews - and think " Well if it is even 75% as good as the reviews, it should be ok".... Well, I can tell you first hand that the Acacia Seaside Inn is everything I read about and more. The staff - Brenda, Freddy - were so helpful in assisting us with our day trip plans. Brenda's suggestion of a day trip to Vieques to do the Bio-Kayak tour was incredible. She said it was "the best" and it was. I fell in love with Vieques Island and the sister property - Inn on the Blue Horizon. Brenda gave us directions for every phase of the trip, from the transportation to the ferry to setting up the Kayak and snorkeling tours for us. Our room on the second level, adjacent to the hot-tub made for some very relaxing evenings after dinner. The Inn is immaculate - from the entry lobby to our room. The hot tub and surrounding area was washed down everyday as well as all tile areas around the Inn. Our room with two double beds was very spacious. Now, let's talk about getting around. The Inn is located in Condado, and we walked almost everywhere. Very safe, as there was always lots of activity and great police presence. When we needed a taxi, the front desk called and it was never more than 4 mintues until the taxi arrived. And of course, the beach is 1/2 block down the street from the Inn and clean and beautiful.
